intro: Pimpinella tenera var. evoluta, commonly known as the curled cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is often cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
